page.title: 07Transport - Barby
page.content: This D-block contains the dismantled remains of the Central Railway, the Oxford Canal (now only used by holiday makers) and the busy A.45. Our survey of the parents ofthe pupils in classes 3 and 4 revealed that every household had at least one car. Several parents also used motor cycles and pedal cycles, only one person used the local bus service. The huge increase in car ownership over the last twenty-five years has brought greater mobility, this combined with Barby's location convenient for the M1 and with easy access to London via Rugby Station, has meant that Barby has gradually changed from being a fairly self sufficient village to a dormitory village where many people are away during the day time returning only to sleep.
